customVariables.name: Weeks into pregnancy when gave birth

options.name: Provide contact information including your phone number, address, email, social media contact information, and contact information of relatives and friends.

Answer interview questions and complete questionnaires on a computer, tablet or phone. These will include questions about your medical and pregnancy history, your current pregnancy, mental health, behaviors, experiences with alcohol, tobacco, or other drugs (including illegal drugs), your relationships with friends and family, your household and work environments and your social, economic and educational background.
Wear a small device on the chest for 3 days during pregnancy to measure your heart rate and answer a few questions about your activities while wearing the device.
Provide a urine sample of about 6-7 tablespoons from yourself
Provide a blood sample taken from a vein in your arm of about 1 ½ tablespoons from yourself
Provide a saliva sample collected by spitting/drooling into a tube or having a cheek swab from yourself

Answer interview questions and complete questionnaires about yourself and your infant including questions about the last part of pregnancy, your mental health, behaviors, experiences with alcohol, tobacco, or other drugs (including illegal drugs), your relationships with friends and family, your household and work environments and your social, economic and educational background, your baby’s health. You will be asked to complete these on a computer, tablet, or phone.
Have your child wear 2 small devices in a set of legwarmers with pockets for 3 continuous days. This will measure their movement and sleep cycles.
Have your child wear 1 small device on the chest or on the leg for 3 continuous days to measure their heart rate, and answer a few questions about your child's activities while wearing this device
Have measurements taken of your child’s weight, length and head size
Consent to release of medical records for your pregnancy and for your child
Provide a sample of toenail or fingernail clippings (about the thickness of a quarter from all 10 nails) from yourself
Provide a saliva sample collected by spitting/drooling into a tube or having a cheek swab from yourself
Provide a urine sample of approximately 2-3 tablespoons from your child
Provide a saliva sample collected by collecting saliva in a tube or swabbing the inside of the cheek from your child
Provide a stool sample collected from your child’s diaper
Have a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan of your child’s brain
Have a mock magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan of your child’s brain
You will be asked to complete a brief survey of your experience with the research procedures at the end of the visit.

Answer interview questions and complete questionnaires about yourself and your infant including questions about your mental health, behaviors, experiences with alcohol, tobacco, or other drugs (including illegal drugs), your relationships with friends and family, your household and work environments and your social, economic and educational background, your baby’s health. You will be asked to answer interview questions and complete questionnaires about your child’s behavior and relationships. You will be asked to complete these on a computer, tablet, or phone
Have your child wear 2 small devices in a set of legwarmers with pockets for 3 continuous days. This will measure their movement and sleep cycles
Have your child wear 1 small device on the chest or on the leg for 3 continuous days to measure their heart rate, and answer a few questions about your child's activities while wearing this device
Have measurements taken of your child’s weight, length and head size
Consent to release of medical records for your pregnancy and for your child
Provide a saliva sample from yourself by spitting/drooling into a tube or having your cheek swabbed
Allow us to collect a saliva sample collected by collecting saliva in a tube or swabbing the inside of the cheek from your child
Allow us to collect a stool sample collected from your child’s diaper
Allow us to collect a urine sample of approximately 2-3 tablespoons from your child
Have a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan of your child’s brain
Have a mock MRI scan of your child’s brain
Have an electroencephalogram (EEG) test of your child’s brain functioning that includes video recording of your child during the procedure
Have a mock electroencephalogram test of your child's brain functioning
You will be asked to complete a brief survey of your experience with the research procedures at the end of the visit.

emailTemplates.name: Send Screening Form
emailTemplates.subject: HBCD Study Screening
emailTemplates.message:
Hello {{participant_first_name}},

Thank you for your interest in the HBCD study. Please complete the screening below with a staff member.

Screening Form

Thank you,

Study Team

emailTemplates.name: Send Signed Consent
emailTemplates.subject: HBCD Study Consent
emailTemplates.message:
Hello {{participant_first_name}},

Thank you again for deciding to participate in this study. Attached is a copy of your signed consent form.

If you have any questions or concerns about the study, feel free to reach out to us: hbcdstudy@health.ucsd.edu

Thank you and welcome,

HBCD Team

emailTemplates.name: HBCD Visit Reminder
emailTemplates.subject: HBCD Visit Reminder
emailTemplates.message:
Hi {{participant_first_name}}!

We wanted to remind you about your HBCD study appointment today. In this appointment, {INSERT SCRIPTS FOR EACH TASK TO BE COMPLETED; Use ‘additionally’ or ‘also’ between tasks for sentence flow}

Please contact us if you have any questions or concerns about this visit at {site_specific_email address}.

Questionnaires

You will be asked to complete an interview and questionnaires about you and/or your child who are participating in this study, including questions about mood, personality, behavior, experiences with substances, relationships with family, and other activities. We do not share information you tell us with any outside sources to ensure privacy and to encourage honest answers.

Athropometrics

Your child’s height, weight, and head circumference will be measured.

EEG

We will record electrical activity from your baby's brain, which is called EEG. Areas of the brain communicate with each other via electrical impulses, and we can measure these impulses by placing a cap of small sensors on your baby's scalp to record brain activity. This will be done while your baby watches a video on a computer screen and listens to different sounds. The EEG cap is a soft, stretchy elastic net with sensor sponges that fit comfortably over your baby’s head like a swim cap. We will also be recording ECG, which monitors heart rate. This is done by attaching an electrode sticker onto your baby's chest. Your baby will be presented with four tasks, hearing sounds, and seeing pictures. All procedures are completely non-invasive, and testing should take about 30 minutes.

To prepare for the EEG, please do not put any hair products or accessories on your baby's head. If possible, please dress your baby in an outfit that allows easy accessibility to their chest for placing the heart rate sticker. It is ideal to do EEG when your baby is awake, calm, and recently fed.

MRI

Your baby will be completing an MRI scan. This will entail you bringing your child to the MRI facility, having them fall asleep, and taking pictures of their brain. To prepare for the appointment, please try to keep your child awake before arriving at the MRI facility and dressing them in comfortable clothing.

Wearable Sensors

At this visit we will place wearable sensors on your baby, which will be worn home. We will provide more information when you are here.

Biospecimens

V1.
During this study visit you will be asked to provide a blood, urine, and saliva sample.

V2.
Maternal: During this study visit we will be collecting a saliva sample from you as well as nail clippings of your toenails (or fingernails as an alternative). Please make sure to take off nail polish from toenails prior to the visit (you will have an option to remove nail polish during the visit if you prefer). Please also refrain from cutting your nails in the days prior to the visit. Finally, we ask that you do not have gel or acrylic nails, if possible.

Child: During this visit we will collect urine, stool, and saliva samples from your child. You do not need to do anything to prepare for this.

V3.
Maternal: During this study visit we will be collecting a saliva sample from you.

Child: During this visit we will collect urine, stool, and saliva samples from your child. You do not need to do anything to prepare for this.

HIPAA Privacy Authorization Form

\n\n

Authorization for Use or Disclosure of Protected Health Information

\n\n

(Required by the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act ---- 45 CFR Parts 160 and 164)

\n" }, { "type": "html", "name": "statement1", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

1. I, {firstName} {lastName}, hereby authorize University of California, San Diego to use and/or disclose the protected health information (‘‘PHI’’) described below to The HEALthy Brain and Child Development Study and its partner organizations.

\n" }, { "type": "html", "name": "statement2", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

2. This medical information may be used by the persons I authorize to receive this information to help researchers understand how children grow and change (develop) early in life by studying many factors that might be helpful or harmful to a child’s development such as exposure to tobacco, alcohol, and other drugs before birth, family members’ mental health and stress, and the child’s exposure to toxins. The overall goal of this study is to better understand how children grow up in different environments.

\n" }, { "type": "html", "name": "question2", "minWidth": "550px", "maxWidth": "550px", "html": "

3. Select Delivery Method: *
(Please check all that apply)

" }, { "type": "checkbox", "name": "deliveryMethod", "minWidth": "550px", "maxWidth": "550px", "indent": 4, "titleLocation": "hidden", "hideNumber": true, "isRequired": true, "choices": [ { "value": "item1", "text": "E-Delivery" }, { "value": "item2", "text": "Mail" }, { "value": "item3", "text": "Fax" } ], "colCount": 3 }, { "type": "html", "name": "statement4", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

4. Authorization for release of PHI shall be effective until the completion of the study or until revoked.

\n" }, { "type": "html", "name": "statement5", "width": "350px", "minWidth": "350px", "maxWidth": "350px", "html": "

5. I hereby authorize the release of PHI as follows: *

" }, { "type": "checkbox", "name": "phiRelease", "minWidth": "550px", "maxWidth": "550px", "indent": 4, "titleLocation": "hidden", "hideNumber": true, "isRequired": true, "choices": [ { "value": "item1", "text": "my complete health record (including records relating to mental health care, infectious diseases including HIV or AIDS, medications, laboratory/pathology results and notes, and treatment of alcohol/drug abuse)." } ] }, { "type": "html", "name": "statement6", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

6. I understand that I have the right to revoke this authorization, in writing, at any time by sending a written notice of revocation to: Dr. Gretchen Bandoli (Address: UC San Diego, 9500 Gilman Drive (MC0828) La Jolla, CA 92093 / Email: hbcdstudy@health.ucsd.edu).
\nI understand that a revocation is not effective to the extent that any person or entity has already acted in reliance on my authorization or if my authorization was obtained as a condition of obtaining insurance coverage and the insurer has a legal right to contest a claim.\n

" }, { "type": "html", "name": "statement7", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

7. I understand that my treatment, payment, enrollment, or eligibility for benefits will not be conditioned on whether I sign this authorization.

" }, { "type": "html", "name": "statement8", "minWidth": "600px", "maxWidth": "600px", "html": "

8. I understand that information used or disclosed pursuant to this authorization may be re-disclosed by the recipient and may no longer be protected by federal or state law.

" } ], "visibleIf": "{fromInternal} = 'Yes'" }, { "name": "page2", "elements": [ { "type": "signaturepad", "name": "patientSignature", "minWidth": "350px", "maxWidth": "350px", "title": "(Signature of
